title: Multiple Select Q11 Spelling Multiple Select
prompt: Which two sentences contain misspelled words?
feedback:
In the sentence “Our company values your advise and expertise about the department’s needs,” the word “advise” is misspelled. The word “advice” is a noun meaning recommendations or guidance. The word “advise” is a verb, meaning to give advice.

In the sentence “In all likelyhood, we will begin making changes to procedures and systems in the next month,” the word “likelyhood” is misspelled. The correct spelling is “likelihood.” When an ending starting with a consonant is added to a word ending in “y,” the “y” is usually changed to an “i,” as in “happiness” or “merriment.”
